title: Seeing Differently: Design Approaches to State Agency Implementation
prompt: A wide overhead shot of a wooden table scattered with hand-drawn diagrams, crumpled sketches, and organizational charts in pencil and pen, with morning light casting long shadows across the papers; a cup of coffee, worn notebook, and pair of glasses suggest hours of redesign work, while the jumbled, iterative nature of the materials—overlapping, crossed-out, rearranged—conveys the messy process of rethinking systems rather than refining measurements; shot in documentary style with shallow depth of field, capturing the texture of paper and the quiet intensity of redesign work in what appears to be a rural office or kitchen table setting.
